name: Introduction to Astronomy
long_desc: Astronomy continues to enjoy a golden age of exploration and discovery. This course presents a broad view of astronomy, straightforwardly descriptive and without any complex mathematics. The goal of the course is to encourage nontechnical students to become scientifically literate and to appreciate new developments in the world of science, especially in the rapidly developing field of astronomy. Subjects covered include the solar system, stars, galaxies and the universe as a whole. The student should develop an appreciation of the everchanging universe and our place within it. Computer laboratory exercises will be used to gain practical experience in astronomical techniques. In addition, small telescopes will be used to study the sky. This course is specifically geared toward nonscienceengineering majors.

custom_fields.goals: To understand the scientific method, how we apply it to learn about the Universe and its contents. In particular students will learn how the nature of the solar system affects the sky viewed from Earth, how planets, stars and galaxies form, and how they fit into the history of the Universe.
custom_fields.key_topics: Science, the Solar System, Stars, Galaxies, Cosmology, Extraterrestrial life.
custom_fields.assessment_structure: Assessment will be through online homeworks, graded computer laboratory exercises carried out during recitation periods, in-class activities during lecture periods, and in-class exams.
custom_fields.relevance: Most relevant for non science and engineering majors
custom_fields.learning_resources: The textbook, Understanding Our Universe includes access to online resources, interactive simulations and practice test banks.
